intro: Castela galapageia f. bindloensis, commonly known as the Galápagos castela, is a unique plant species native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant typically features small, elliptical leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stem. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within the archipelago.
